intro: Oreomyrrhis involucrata var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, pubescent leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid environments. It is adapted to thrive in full sun and has a low, spreading growth habit. The species is part of the Plantaginaceae family and is often found in desert or semi-desert regions.
